intro: Listrostachys scheffleriana, commonly known as the giant umbrella plant, is a striking member of the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its large, umbrella-like compound leaves that can reach up to 3 meters in diameter. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by bright red berries that are edible for birds. Native to Southeast Asia, it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its size and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
